history.proof: unfold rel_iter. split. - intros [y0 [H1 H2]]. qsimpl time: 1. - intros H. qsimpl time: 1.

exceptions.exn: No such goal. Focus next goal with bullet -.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
R: X -> X -> Prop
y: X
x: X

Goal:
rel_iter 1 x y <-> R x y

Premises:
rel_iter = fix rel_iter (n : nat) : X -> X -> Prop := match n with | 0 => eq | S n0 => fun x z : X => exists y : X, R x y /\ rel_iter n0 y z end : nat -> X -> X -> Prop Arguments rel_iter _%nat_scope
Tauto.eval_f_morph : forall (ex : ?TX -> Prop) (ev ev' : ?TA -> Prop) (f : Tauto.GFormula), (forall a : ?TA, ev a <-> ev' a) -> Tauto.eval_f ex ev f < -> Tauto.eval_f ex ev' f where ?TA : [X : Type R : X -> X -> Prop x : X y : X |- Type] ?TX : [X : Type R : X -> X -> Prop x : X y : X |- Type] ?AA : [X : Type R : X -> X -> Prop x : X y : X |- Type] ?AF : [X : Type R : X -> X -> Prop x : X y : X |- Type]
ZifyClasses.uop_iff : forall p1 q1 : Prop, p1 < -> q1 -> ?Op p1 < -> ?Op q1 where ?Op : [X : Type R : X -> X -> Prop x : X y : X |- Prop -> Prop] ?PropUOp : [X : Type R : X -> X -> Prop x : X y : X |- ZifyClasses.PropUOp ?Op]
ZifyClasses.op_iff : forall p1 p2 q1 q2 : Prop, p1 < -> q1 -> p2 < -> q2 -> ?Op p1 p2 < -> ?Op q1 q2 where ?Op : [X : Type R : X -> X -> Prop x : X y : X |- Prop -> Prop -> Prop] ?PropOp : [X : Type R : X -> X -> Prop x : X y : X |- ZifyClasses.PropOp ?Op]
Tauto.GFormula_ind : forall P : Tauto.GFormula -> Prop, P Tauto.TT -> P Tauto.FF -> (forall t : ?TX, P (Tauto.X t)) -> (forall (t : ?TA) (a : ?AA), P (Tauto.A t a)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.Cj g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.D g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> P (Tauto.N g)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall (o : option ?AF) (g0 : Tauto.GFormula), P g0 -> P (Tauto.I g o g0)) ->...-> Prop x : X y : X |- Type]
measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
rel_iter_plus : forall (n m : nat) (x y : X), rel_iter (n + m) x y < -> (exists a : X, rel_iter n x a /\ rel_iter m a y)

ZCoeff.rlt_morph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> rlt x x0 < -> rlt y y0
ZCoeff.rle_morph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> rle x x0 < -> rle y y0
OrderedRing.rlt_morph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> rlt x x0 < -> rlt y y0
RingMicromega.rlt_morph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> rlt x x0 < -> rlt y y0
RingMicromega.rle_morph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> rle x x0 < -> rle y y0
OrderedRing.rle_morph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> rle x x0 < -> rle y y0
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Zbool.Zeq_bool = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinInt.Z.compare x y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments Zbool.Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
RingMicromega.eq0_cnf : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x : R, (rlt rO x -> False) /\ (rlt rO (ropp x) -> False) < -> req x rO
BinInt.Z.peano_ind : forall P : BinNums.Z -> Prop, P BinNums.Z0 -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, P x -> P (BinInt.Z.succ x)) -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, P x -> P (BinInt.Z.pred x)) -> forall z : BinNums.Z, P z
forall_bound_equiv : forall (X : Type) (A P Q : X -> Prop), (forall n : X, A n -> P n <-> Q n) -> (forall n : X, A n -> P n) < -> (forall n : X, A n -> Q n)
exists_equiv : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop), (forall n : X, P n <-> Q n) -> (exists n : X, P n) < -> (exists n : X, Q n)
BinInt.Z.bi_induction : forall P : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful BinInt.Z.eq iff) P -> P BinNums.Z0 -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, P x <-> P (BinInt.Z.succ x)) -> forall z : BinNums.Z, P z
BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add x (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.succ _%Z_scope

```coq
unfold rel_iter.
simpl.
split.
- intros [y0 [H1 H2]].
  exists y0.
  split; assumption.
- intros H.
  destruct H as [y0 [H1 H2]].
  exists y0.
  split; assumption.
Qed.

original: unfold rel_iter. simpl. split. - intros [y0 [H1 H2]]. exists y0. split; auto. - intros H. destruct H as [y0 [H1 H2]]. exists y0. split; auto.
